member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.ClientAuthorizationStrings.RefreshTokenInappropriateForRequestType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The request message type {0} should not be responded to with a refresh token..

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.ClientAuthorizationStrings.TokenEndpointErrorFormat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Authorization Server's token endpoint generated error {0}: '{1}'.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.ClientType
member.summary: OAuth 2 Client types

remarks.para: Based on their ability to authenticate securely with the authorization server (i.e. ability to maintain the confidentiality of their client credentials).
The client type designation is based on the authorization server's definition of secure authentication and its acceptable exposure levels of client credentials.
The authorization server SHOULD NOT make assumptions about the client type, nor accept the type information provided by the client developer without first establishing trust.

A client application consisting of multiple components, each with its own client type (e.g. a distributed client with both a confidential server-based component and a public browser-based component), MUST register each component separately as a different client to ensure proper handling by the authorization server. The authorization server MAY provider tools to manage such complex clients through a single administration interface.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.ClientType.Confidential
member.summary: Clients capable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials (e.g. client implemented on a secure server with restricted access to the client credentials), or capable of secure client authentication using other means.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.ClientType.Public
member.summary: Clients incapable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials (e.g. clients executing on the device used by the resource owner such as an installed native application or a web browser-based application), and incapable of secure client authentication via any other means.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.IClientDescription
member.summary: A description of a client from an Authorization Server's point of view.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.IClientDescription.IsCallbackAllowed(System.Uri)
member.summary: Determines whether a callback URI included in a client's authorization request is among those allowed callbacks for the registered client.
member.param: The absolute URI the client has requested the authorization result be received at. Never null.
member.returns: true if the callback URL is allowable for this client; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: At the point this method is invoked, the identity of the client has not been confirmed. To avoid open redirector attacks, the alleged client's identity is used to lookup a list of allowable callback URLs to make sure that the callback URL the actual client is requesting is one of the expected ones.

From OAuth 2.0 section 2.1: The authorization server SHOULD require the client to pre-register their redirection URI or at least certain components such as the scheme, host, port and path. If a redirection URI was registered, the authorization server MUST compare any redirection URI received at the authorization endpoint with the registered URI.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.IClientDescription.IsValidClientSecret(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified client secret is correct.
member.param: The secret obtained from the client.
member.returns: true if the secret matches the one in the authorization server's record for the client; false otherwise.
member.remarks: All string equality checks, whether checking secrets or their hashes, should be done using to mitigate timing attacks.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.IClientDescription.DefaultCallback
member.summary: Gets the callback to use when an individual authorization request does not include an explicit callback URI.
member.value: An absolute URL; or null if none is registered.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.IClientDescription.ClientType
member.summary: Gets the type of the client.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.IClientDescription.HasNonEmptySecret
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a non-empty secret is registered for this client.

member.summary: Determines whether a callback URI included in a client's authorization request is among those allowed callbacks for the registered client.
member.param: The requested callback URI.
member.returns: true if the callback is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.param: The secret obtained from the client.
member.returns: true if the secret matches the one in the authorization server's record for the client; false otherwise.
member.remarks: All string equality checks, whether checking secrets or their hashes, should be done using to mitigate timing attacks.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AccessTokenAuthorizationCodeRequest
member.summary: A request from a Client to an Authorization Server to exchange an authorization code for an access token, and (at the authorization server's option) a refresh token.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AccessTokenRequestBase
member.summary: A message sent from the client to the authorization server to exchange a previously obtained grant for an access token.

member.summary: The backing for the property.

member.param: The Authorization Server's access token endpoint URL.
The version.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AuthenticatedClientRequestBase.ClientIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the client identifier previously obtained from the Authorization Server.
member.value: The client identifier.
member.remarks: Not required, because the client id may be communicate through alternate means like HTTP Basic authentication (the OAuth 2 spec allows a lot of freedom here).

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AuthenticatedClientRequestBase.ClientSecret
member.summary: Gets the client secret.
member.value: The client secret.
member.remarks: REQUIRED. The client secret as described in Section 2.1 (Client Credentials). OPTIONAL if no client secret was issued.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AuthenticatedClientRequestBase.Headers
member.summary: Gets the HTTP headers of the request.
member.value: May be an empty collection, but must not be null.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AccessTokenRequestBase.EnsureValidMessage
member.summary: Checks the message state for conformity to the protocol specification and throws an exception if the message is invalid.

remarks.para: Some messages have required fields, or combinations of fields that must relate to each other in specialized ways. After deserializing a message, this method checks the state of the message to see if it conforms to the protocol.
Note that this property should not check signatures or perform any state checks outside this scope of this particular message.

member.exception: Thrown if the message is invalid.

member.value: Always true, because of our base class.

member.remarks: > The refresh token will never be provided when this value is false. The refresh token may be provided when this value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the refresh token.
member.value: The refresh token.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AccessTokenSuccessResponse.Scope
member.summary: Gets the scope of access being requested.
member.value: The scope of the access request expressed as a list of space-delimited strings. The value of the scope parameter is defined by the authorization server. If the value contains multiple space-delimited strings, their order does not matter, and each string adds an additional access range to the requested scope.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AccessTokenSuccessResponse.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#Messages#IAccessTokenIssuingResponse#Lifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the lifetime of the access token.
member.value: The lifetime.

member.summary: Gets the authorization that the token describes.

member.param: The URL to redirect to so the client receives the message. This may not be built into the request message if the client pre-registered the URL with the authorization server.
The protocol version.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationFailedResponse.#ctor(System.Uri,DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The URL to redirect to so the client receives the message. This may not be built into the request message if the client pre-registered the URL with the authorization server.
The authorization request from the user agent on behalf of the client.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationFailedResponse.Error
member.summary: Gets or sets the error.
member.value: One of the values given in . OR a numerical HTTP status code from the 4xx or 5xx range, with the exception of the 400 (Bad Request) and 401 (Unauthorized) status codes. For example, if the service is temporarily unavailable, the authorization server MAY return an error response with "error" set to "503".

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationFailedResponse.ErrorDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets a human readable description of the error.
member.value: Human-readable text providing additional information, used to assist in the understanding and resolution of the error that occurred.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationFailedResponse.ErrorUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the web page that describes the error and possible resolution.
member.value: A URI identifying a human-readable web page with information about the error, used to provide the end-user with additional information about the error.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationFailedResponse.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#Messages#IMessageWithClientState#ClientState
member.summary: Gets or sets some state as provided by the client in the authorization request.
member.value: An opaque value defined by the client.
member.remarks: REQUIRED if the Client sent the value in the .

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationImplicitRequest
member.summary: A message sent by a web application Client to the AuthorizationServer via the user agent to obtain authorization from the user and prepare to issue an access token to the client if permission is granted.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest
member.summary: A message sent by a web application Client to the AuthorizationServer via the user agent to obtain authorization from the user and prepare to issue an access token to the client if permission is granted.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.ResponseTypeConst
member.summary: Gets the grant type that the client expects of the authorization server.
member.value: Always . Other response types are not supported.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Version)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Authorization Server's user authorization URL to direct the user to.
The protocol version.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.EnsureValidMessage
member.summary: Checks the message state for conformity to the protocol specification and throws an exception if the message is invalid.
member.exception: Thrown if the message is invalid.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.ResponseType
member.summary: Gets the grant type that the client expects of the authorization server.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.ClientIdentifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier by which this client is known to the Authorization Server.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.Callback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback URL.
member.value: An absolute URL to which the Authorization Server will redirect the User back after the user has approved the authorization request.
member.remarks: REQUIRED unless a redirection URI has been established between the client and authorization server via other means. An absolute URI to which the authorization server will redirect the user-agent to when the end-user authorization step is completed. The authorization server MAY require the client to pre-register their redirection URI. The redirection URI MUST NOT include a query component as defined by [RFC3986] (Berners-Lee, T., Fielding, R., and L. Masinter, Uniform Resource Identifier (URI): Generic Syntax, January 2005.) section 3 if the state parameter is present.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.ClientState
member.summary: Gets or sets state of the client that should be sent back with the authorization response.
member.value: An opaque value that Clients can use to maintain state associated with this request.
member.remarks: This data is proprietary to the client and should be considered an opaque string to the authorization server.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationRequest.Scope
member.summary: Gets the scope of access being requested.
member.value: The scope of the access request expressed as a list of space-delimited strings. The value of the scope parameter is defined by the authorization server. If the value contains multiple space-delimited strings, their order does not matter, and each string adds an additional access range to the requested scope.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationImplicitRequest.ResponseTypeConst
member.summary: Gets or sets the grant type that the client expects of the authorization server.
member.value: Always . Other response types are not supported.

The protocol version.

member.summary: Gets the grant type that the client expects of the authorization server.

member.summary: Gets or sets the result of calling the authorization server host's access token creation method.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationImplicitRequest.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#Messages#IAccessTokenRequest#UserName
member.summary: Gets the username of the authorizing user, when applicable.
member.value: A non-empty string; or null when no user has authorized this access token.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationImplicitRequest.DotNetOpenAuth#OAuth2#Messages#IAccessTokenRequest#ClientAuthenticated
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the client requesting the access token has authenticated itself.
member.value: Always false because authorization requests only include the client_id, without a secret.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationResponseType
member.summary: An indication of what kind of response the client is requesting from the authorization server after the user has granted authorized access.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationResponseType.AccessToken
member.summary: An access token should be returned immediately.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationResponseType.AuthorizationCode
member.summary: An authorization code should be returned, which can later be exchanged for refresh and access tokens.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationSuccessAccessTokenResponse
member.summary: The message sent by the Authorization Server to the Client via the user agent to indicate that user authorization was granted, carrying only an access token, and to return the user to the Client where they started their experience.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.EndUserAuthorizationSuccessResponseBase
member.summary: The message sent by the Authorization Server to the Client via the user agent to indicate that user authorization was granted, and to return the user to the Client where they started their experience.

member.value: An opaque value defined by the client.

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.GrantType
member.summary: The types of authorizations that a client can use to obtain a refresh token and/or an access token.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.GrantType.AuthorizationCode
member.summary: The client is providing the authorization code previously obtained from an end user authorization response.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.GrantType.Password
member.summary: The client is providing the end user's username and password to the authorization server.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.GrantType.Assertion
member.summary: The client is providing an assertion it obtained from another source.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.GrantType.RefreshToken
member.summary: The client is providing a refresh token.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.GrantType.ClientCredentials
member.summary: No authorization to access a user's data has been given. The client is requesting an access token authorized for its own private data. This fits the classic OAuth 1.0(a) "2-legged OAuth" scenario.
member.remarks: When requesting an access token using the none access grant type (no access grant is included), the client is requesting access to the protected resources under its control, or those of another resource owner which has been previously arranged with the authorization server (the method of which is beyond the scope of this specification).

member.name: T:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException
member.summary: Describes an error generated by an Authorization Server's token endpoint.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException.requestMessage
member.summary: The message being processed that caused this exception to be thrown.

member.name: F:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException.authenticateHeader
member.summary: The WWW-Authenticate header to add to the response message.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException.#ctor(DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.Messages.AccessTokenRequestBase,System.String,System.String,System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The message whose processing resulted in this error.
A single error code from .
A human-readable UTF-8 encoded text providing additional information, used to assist the client developer in understanding the error that occurred.
A URI identifying a human-readable web page with information about the error, used to provide the client developer with additional information about the error.
The WWW-Authenticate header to add to the response.

member.name: M:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException.#ctor(System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inner exception.

member.summary: Gets the response message to send to the client.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException.Error
member.summary: Gets a single error code from .

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException.Description
member.summary: Gets a human-readable UTF-8 encoded text providing additional information, used to assist the client developer in understanding the error that occurred.

member.name: P:DotNetOpenAuth.OAuth2.TokenEndpointProtocolException.MoreInformation
member.summary: Gets a URI identifying a human-readable web page with information about the error, used to provide the client developer with additional information about the error.
